title: Katmai National Park & Preserve: NEPA Documents
body: Explore This Park    Get Involved     Planning     NEPA Documents              NEPA Documents       What Is NEPA?  NEPA is the acronym for the National Environmental Policy Act. This act, passed in 1969, laid the foundation for environmental protection in the United States by setting policy goals for the federal government. Two major requirements of the act are that agencies analyze the environmental impacts of federal actions and engage the public in the decision-making process.  Learn more about NEPA:  NEPA Statute Citizen's Guide to NEPA  Katmai's NEPA Documents  You'll find a variety of environmental assessments and other documents for Katmai at parkplanning.nps.gov/katm.
